instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen no touchbar
threads.message: got a pre worked on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, they replaced <CAPACITOR>C7053</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7055</CAPACITOR> <RESISTOR>R8442</RESISTOR> and edp connector. fan spin and all. no idea why they replaced all of that, they usc it so i have no clue remaining. i saw more oxidation on <CHIP>U8500</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8501</CHIP>, repalced those to be sure but still no <SIGNAL>PANEL_3V3_EN</SIGNAL> and panel <SIGNAL>P5V_EN</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen no touchbar
threads.message: Any sign of corrosion near the CPU on the front side? If so, this is probably dead. Apple made a stupid design on the LCD connector and put the backlight line next to a CPU data line.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen no touchbar
threads.message: no, damage was only on the back/keyboard side. although this was uscd before

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen no touchbar
threads.message: Look very closely near the caps and fets above the CPU for any signs of previous liquid damage. If nothing, then this won't be super fun is CPU VCore present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen no touchbar
threads.message:
i checkd and it seems clean. customer said it worked on external screen. i got image on external once. now nope. cpu is getting warm (not hot) i get 1.1 on l7270, l8050 and such, but i have no voltage on l7220 l7210 l7410 l 7420 l7430

they are all from 3 to 7 ohm to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen no touchbar
threads.message:
If you got external image this can point to internal video out issue on CPU.
Usually caused by overvoltage from backlight to CPU video outputs after liquid damage.
Strange that you got external one time only.
You can now put good flux and reflow CPU area.
You may have luck and is only crap which blocks some data bus...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen no touchbar
threads.message: i did not know that i could have a working cpu with dead outputs. interesting. i have replaced cpus before (in other machines), so in case i can replace this one too. Is it possible to source good ones?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen no touchbar
threads.message: If you get external video, but no internal, you likely have a dead MUX. If you get neither, this is probably a dead CPU.
